explicit

Interface MDP

  • All Superinterfaces:
    MDPGeneric<java.lang.Double>, Model, NondetModel
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    CTMDP
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CTMDPSimple, MDPAdditionalChoices, MDPDroppedAllChoices, MDPDroppedChoicesCached, MDPEquiv, MDPExplicit, MDPFromDTMC, MDPSimple, MDPSparse, MDPView, STPGExplicit

    public interface MDP
extends MDPGeneric<java.lang.Double>
    Interface for classes that provide (read) access to an explicit-state MDP, where the transition probabilities are stored as double floating point values.
    For the generic methods, e.g., the prob0 / prob1 precomputations that do not care about the concrete values, see MDPGeneric.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  MDP.TransitionConsumer
      Functional interface for a consumer, accepting transitions (s,t,d), i.e., from state s to state t with value d.
      static interface  MDP.TransitionToDoubleFunction
      Functional interface for a function mapping transitions (s,t,d), i.e., from state s to state t with value d, to a double value.

        getTransitionsIterator in interface MDPGeneric<java.lang.Double>

      • forEachTransition

        default void forEachTransition(int s,
                               int i,
                               MDP.TransitionConsumer c)
        Iterate over the outgoing transitions of state s and choice i and call the accept method of the consumer for each of them:
        Call accept(s,t,d) where t is the successor state d = P(s,i,t) is the probability from s to t with choice i.

        Default implementation: The default implementation relies on iterating over the iterator returned by getTransitionsIterator().

        Note: This method is the base for the default implementation of the numerical computation methods (mvMult, etc). In derived classes, it may thus be worthwhile to provide a specialised implementation for this method that avoids using the Iterator mechanism.

        Parameters:
        s - the state s
        i - the choice i
        c - the consumer

      • sumOverTransitions

        default double sumOverTransitions(int s,
                                  int i,
                                  MDP.TransitionToDoubleFunction f)
        Iterate over the outgoing transitions of state s and choice i, call the function f and return the sum of the result values:
        Return sum_t f(s, t, P(s,i,t)), where t ranges over the i-successors of s.
        Parameters:
        s - the state s
        c - the consumer

      • mvMultMinMax

        default void mvMultMinMax(double[] vect,
                          boolean min,
                          double[] result,
                          java.util.BitSet subset,
                          boolean complement,
                          int[] strat)
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max, i.e. one step of value iteration, i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_k { sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j] } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        result - Vector to store result in
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultMinMax

        default void mvMultMinMax(double[] vect,
                          boolean min,
                          double[] result,
                          java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states,
                          int[] strat)
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max, i.e. one step of value iteration, i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_k { sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j] } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        result - Vector to store result in
        states - Perform computation for these rows, in the iteration order
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultSingle

        default double mvMultSingle(int s,
                            int i,
                            double[] vect)
        Do a single row of matrix-vector multiplication for a specific choice.
        Parameters:
        s - State (row) index
        i - Choice index
        vect - Vector to multiply by

      • mvMultGSMinMax

        default double mvMultGSMinMax(double[] vect,
                              boolean min,
                              java.util.BitSet subset,
                              boolean complement,
                              boolean absolute,
                              int[] strat)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = min/max_k { (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } and store new values directly in vect as computed. The maximum (absolute/relative) difference between old/new elements of vect is also returned. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        absolute - If true, compute absolute, rather than relative, difference
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
        Returns:
        The maximum difference between old/new elements of vect

      • mvMultGSMinMax

        default double mvMultGSMinMax(double[] vect,
                              boolean min,
                              java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states,
                              boolean absolute,
                              int[] strat)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = min/max_k { (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } and store new values directly in vect as computed. The maximum (absolute/relative) difference between old/new elements of vect is also returned. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        states - Perform computation for these rows, in the iteration order
        absolute - If true, compute absolute, rather than relative, difference
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
        Returns:
        The maximum difference between old/new elements of vect

      • mvMultGSMinMaxIntervalIter

        default void mvMultGSMinMaxIntervalIter(double[] vect,
                                        boolean min,
                                        java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states,
                                        int[] strat,
                                        boolean ensureMonotonic,
                                        boolean fromBelow)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication followed by min/max in the context of interval iteration. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = min/max_k { (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } and store new values directly in vect as computed. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        states - Perform computation for these rows, in the iteration order
        ensureMonotonic - ensure monotonicity
        fromBelow - iteration from below or from above? (for ensureMonotonicity)

      • mvMultRewMinMax

        default void mvMultRewMinMax(double[] vect,
                             MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                             boolean min,
                             double[] result,
                             java.util.BitSet subset,
                             boolean complement,
                             int[] strat)
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max, i.e. one step of value iteration. i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j] } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        result - Vector to store result in
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

        Do a matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max, i.e. one step of value iteration. i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j] } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.

      • mvDiscountedMultRewMinMax

        void mvDiscountedMultRewMinMax(double[] vect,
                               MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                               boolean min,
                               double[] result,
                               double discount,
                               java.util.BitSet subset,
                               boolean complement,
                               int[] strat)
        Do a matrix-vector multiplication and sum of discounted rewards followed by min/max, i.e. one step of value iteration. i.e. for all s: result[s] = min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + discount*(sum_j P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        result - Vector to store result in
        discount - The discount factor (in (0,1])
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultRewGSMinMax

        default double mvMultRewGSMinMax(double[] vect,
                                 MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                 boolean min,
                                 java.util.BitSet subset,
                                 boolean complement,
                                 boolean absolute,
                                 int[] strat)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } and store new values directly in vect as computed. The maximum (absolute/relative) difference between old/new elements of vect is also returned. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        subset - Only do multiplication for these rows (ignored if null)
        complement - If true, subset is taken to be its complement (ignored if subset is null)
        absolute - If true, compute absolute, rather than relative, difference
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
        Returns:
        The maximum difference between old/new elements of vect

      • mvMultRewGSMinMax

        default double mvMultRewGSMinMax(double[] vect,
                                 MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                 boolean min,
                                 java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states,
                                 boolean absolute,
                                 int[] strat)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } and store new values directly in vect as computed. The maximum (absolute/relative) difference between old/new elements of vect is also returned. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        states - Perform computation for these rows, in the iteration order
        absolute - If true, compute absolute, rather than relative, difference
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
        Returns:
        The maximum difference between old/new elements of vect

      • mvMultRewGSMinMaxIntervalIter

        default void mvMultRewGSMinMaxIntervalIter(double[] vect,
                                           MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                           boolean min,
                                           java.util.PrimitiveIterator.OfInt states,
                                           int[] strat,
                                           boolean ensureMonotonic,
                                           boolean fromBelow)
        Do a Gauss-Seidel-style matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max, for interval iteration. i.e. for all s: vect[s] = min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } and store new values directly in vect as computed. Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        vect - Vector to multiply by (and store the result in)
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        states - Perform computation for these rows, in the iteration order
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)
        ensureMonotonic - enforce monotonicity?
        fromBelow - interval iteration from below? (for ensureMonotonic)

      • mvMultRewJacMinMaxSingle

        default double mvMultRewJacMinMaxSingle(int s,
                                        double[] vect,
                                        MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                        boolean min,
                                        int[] strat)
        Do a single row of Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards followed by min/max. i.e. return min/max_k { rew(s) + rew_k(s) + (sum_{j!=s} P_k(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_k(s,s) } Optionally, store optimal (memoryless) strategy info.
        Parameters:
        s - State (row) index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max for (true=min, false=max)
        strat - Storage for (memoryless) strategy choice indices (ignored if null)

      • mvMultRewJacSingle

        default double mvMultRewJacSingle(int s,
                                  int i,
                                  double[] vect,
                                  MDPRewards mdpRewards)
        Do a single row of Jacobi-style matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards, for a specific choice. i.e. return rew(s) + rew_i(s) + (sum_{j!=s} P_i(s,j)*vect[j]) / 1-P_i(s,s) }
        Parameters:
        s - State (row) index
        i - the choice index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards

      • mvMultRewMinMaxSingleChoices

        default java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> mvMultRewMinMaxSingleChoices(int s,
                                                                       double[] vect,
                                                                       MDPRewards mdpRewards,
                                                                       boolean min,
                                                                       double val)
        Determine which choices result in min/max after a single row of matrix-vector multiplication and sum of rewards.
        Parameters:
        s - State (row) index
        vect - Vector to multiply by
        mdpRewards - The rewards
        min - Min or max (true=min, false=max)
        val - Min or max value to match

      • mvMultRight

        default void mvMultRight(int[] states,
                         int[] strat,
                         double[] source,
                         double[] dest)
        Multiply the probability matrix induced by the MDP and strat to the right of source. Only those entries in source and only those columns in the probability matrix are considered, that are elements of states. The result of this multiplication is added to the contents of dest.
        Parameters:
        states - States for which to multiply
        strat - (Memoryless) strategy to use
        source - Vector to multiply matrix with
        dest - Vector to write result to.
